title.narrative: 3.2 - QUALITY BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: 3.2-The Ministry of Education has increased capacity to provide quality basic education (grades 1-8) especially for the most disadvantaged children including those with disabilities, those who do not speak Nepali language at home, and in remote areas, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, all children, especially the most disadvantaged benefit from improved access, participation and learning outcomes in pre- primary and basic education within inclusive, safe and protective environments.

participating-org.narrative: CENTER FOR EDUCATION AND HUMAN RESO DEVELOPMENT
KHADACHAKRA NAGARPALIKA NA KA PA OF

sector.narrative: Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - mother tongue / multilingual education
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.2-The Ministry of Education has increased capacity to provide quality basic education (grades 1-8) especially for the mostdisadvantaged children including those with disabilities, those who do not speak Nepali language at home, and in remote areas

description.narrative: School closures due to COVID-19 have hampered the face-to-face teaching learning in schools however self-learning packs and other forms of alternative learning modalities proved crucial for ensuring learning, mother tongue as mode of instruction and disability inclusive education provided support to the most marginalized children. Tole Siksha (community learning circles) were introduced and proved an effective strategy to continue learning during school closures. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2021
